page.title: 06Church Construction
page.content:
13th & 14th Century
Alterations started and the present {nave and chancel}were added. The early English{lancet windows}at the East end of the lady chapel were put in at this time. The{font}is of the 13th Century and is made of{Purbec marble}with two shallow circles on each face and it rests on several pillars.
15th Century
All the windows were replaced at a time in what is known as the {Perpendicular style.}The south porch is probably of this period with a brick frame around the edge. Some of the{buttresses}were added at this time.
